qas.question: In what year did Dominic establish a convent?
What women did Dominic convert for his convent?
What group are older than the Dominican Friars?
Why did families send their girls to Diego's monastery?
How long after his mission did Prior Diego die?
Who became the spiritual father of several Albigensian women?
What would become a foundation of the Benedictine nuns?
What later became the Benedictine headquarters for Dominic's missionary effort?
Why did families not send their girls to Diego's monastery?

context: <b5_0>Dominic<b5_0/> became the spiritual father to several <a1_0>Albigensian<a1_0/> women he had reconciled to the faith, and in <a0_0>1206<a0_0/> he established them in <b6_0>a <b7_0>convent<b7_0/> in Prouille<b6_0/>. This convent would become the foundation of the Dominican nuns, thus making the <a2_0>Dominican nuns<a2_0/> older than the Dominican friars. Prior Diego sanctioned the building of a monastery for girls whose parents had sent them to the care of the Albigensians because their families were <a3_0><b9_0>too poor<b9_0/><a3_0/> to fulfill their basic needs. <b8_0>The monastery<b8_0/> was at Prouille would later become Dominic's headquarters for his missionary effort there. After <a4_0>two years<a4_0/> on the mission field, Prior Diego died while traveling back to Spain. When his preaching companions heard of his death, all save Dominic and a very small number of others returned to their homes.
